TrueFalse.quesTitle: True and False Question with Multiple Sub-Questions with Answer Options as Horizontal and Left aligned Version 2
TrueFalse.promptText: Mary is a spoilt, unpleasant girl with a bad temper Version 2
TrueFalse.instructionText: Are the following sentences true (T) or false (F)?
subQues: Mary Lennox’s Indian nanny met her in London and they took the train to Yorkshire.
Mrs Medlock didn’t like Mary because she was bad-­‐tempered.
Mr Craven locked up his wife’s garden and kept the key in his pocket.
Martha worked as a housemaid at Misselthwaite Manor, but she lived on the moor with her family.

MultipleResponse.quesTitle: MCMR Question with Single Sub-Question with Answer Options as Vertically aligned Version 2
MultipleResponse.instructionText: Select more that one options for the following question Version 2
MultipleResponse.promptText: Gestalt Psychology states that the whole is different from the sum of its parts. How does the term gestalt relate to the psychological study of perception? Gestalt psychology was popular in the 20th century, but it has been replaced by psycholinguistics.
MultipleResponse.questionText: Identify the parts of the plants in the given options:
subQues: Which of the following laws do not belong to Gestalt Phycology

MCQSR.promptText: There are twelve of us and my father doesn’t earn much money. It’s hard for my mother to feed them all. The fresh air on the moor makes them strong and healthy. Dickon is twelve and he’s always out on the moor. He loves animals.
subQues: When the wind blew the ivy to one side
As soon as Mary met Dickon
Mr Craven returned home to Misselthwaite Manor
Colin felt that the secret garden
answerKey: Mary found the door to the secret garden.
Mary found the key to the secret garden.
Mary saw Ben Weatherstaff looking at her.
she didn’t want to talk to him.
she was afraid of him and ran away.
they started to play ball together.
she liked him and trusted him.
because he had to talk to Ben Weatherstaff.
because Mrs Medlock wrote him a letter.
because he dreamt about his wife’s garden.
could help him grow strong and healthy.

writing.questionTitle: Short Essay About Uttar Pradesh with 500 words. See description in Instruction
writing.questionInstruction: Write Essay about Uttar Pradesh. provide details about districts, Religion, Famous Places, Area, Politics. Should be not ore than 500 words. Key points: Modern human hunter-gatherers have been in Uttar Pradesh[15][16][17] since between around[18] 85,000 and 72,000 years ago.
